chap10

Class StaffMember

  • java.lang.Object
    • chap10.StaffMember
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Employee, Volunteer

    public abstract class StaffMember
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an abstract staff member. We do not know how to pay the staff member, so subclasses will have to provide the pay method.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Lewis, Loftus

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StaffMember()
      No argument constructor.
      StaffMember(java.lang.String eName, java.lang.String eAddress, java.lang.String ePhone)
      Constructor: Sets up this staff member using the specified information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract double pay()
      Derived classes must define the pay method for each type of employee.
      void readInstanceData(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Read instance data from scanner.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string including the basic employee information.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaffMember

        public StaffMember()
        No argument constructor. For creating components to be initialized from a Scanner

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string including the basic employee information.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        each element on separate line

      • pay

        public abstract double pay()
        Derived classes must define the pay method for each type of employee.
        Returns:
        amount staff member is paid

      • readInstanceData

        public void readInstanceData(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Read instance data from scanner. Subclasses that add instance data should override to read additional data.
        Parameters:
        scan - Should be positioned before the instance data. Each field should be a token.
